subclusters.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening as a mitotic clock triggering DNA damage responses and cellular senescence, linking telomere attrition directly to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes telomere shortening causing cellular senescence and organismal aging, with telomere length as an aging biomarker and link to cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere shortening due to end replication problem leading to cellular senescence, with telomerase counteracting erosion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details telomere shortening limiting cell division and telomerase role, linking telomere dysfunction to premature aging diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on progressive telomere shortening as a cellular clock causing senescence and telomerase reactivation in cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights telomere shortening as mitotic clock triggering senescence and antagonistic pleiotropy in telomerase regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links telomere attrition to cellular senescence, oxidative stress acceleration, and telomere length as biomarker of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere erosion driving senescence, telomerase repair, and correlation of attrition rate with lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details telomeres as mitotic clocks, telomerase role, senescence induction, and telomere length as aging biomarker.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere length as mitotic clock, attrition driving senescence, and telomerase modulation affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes telomere shortening as biological clock balancing tumor suppression and tissue degeneration, with telomerase and shelterin roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Classic marginotomy theory describing telomere shortening as cell division counter triggering senescence and telomerase compensation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Marginotomy theory focusing on incomplete replication causing telomere shortening limiting cell division and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomeres as protective ends shortening with division, triggering senescence, with telomerase maintaining stem cell replicative potential.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere length and attrition rates determining replicative senescence and species lifespan differences.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links telomere shortening-induced replicative senescence specifically to immune aging and immune function decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Introduces replicative mosaicism concept but centers on telomere shortening limiting proliferation and causing focal cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere shortening as cumulative damage marker accelerated by stress, linking to biological aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates telomere erosion as mitotic clock with disposable soma theory, balancing tumor suppression and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere Attrition and Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes telomere attrition as adaptive strategy balancing maintenance costs, tumor suppression, and life-history regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Accelerated Telomere Attrition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on early life and chronic stress accelerating telomere shortening via inflammation, oxidative stress, and endocrine dysregulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Accelerated Telomere Attrition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Telomere hormesis hypothesis linking low-level stress-induced telomere shortening to adaptive responses and tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-p53-Mitochondrial Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates telomere dysfunction activating p53, repressing PGC-1 coactivators, causing mitochondrial and metabolic decline in aging heart.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-p53-Mitochondrial Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere attrition triggering senescence and mitochondrial dysfunction via p53-mediated repression of mitochondrial biogenesis.
